DataElement.preferredName: Disease Assessment TNM Classification Staging Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicates the TNM staging of a malignant condition of the body

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: examination of a malignant condition of the body with the intention to categorize extent of cancer using a system describing the size of the tumor, any lymph nodes that are involved, and presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Property.preferredDefinition: A system of clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A system for clinicopathologic evaluation of tumors based on the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion), and lymph node involvement (N) and metastasis (M) each followed by a number starting at 0 for no evident metastasis; numbers used depend on the organ involved and influence the prognosis and choice of treatment.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._Text; the words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013
